Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of added white and red bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 165, no. 28)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 712, no. 696)
CVA Cambridge I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 6, Cambridge, Fasc. 1 (p. 33, no. 26, pl. XVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1878) (phase 2)
